posts.title: Gemini 4 Mission
posts.body: I’m coming back in… and it’s the saddest moment of my life.

posts.title: First Manned Mission
posts.body: I feel fine. How about you?

posts.title: Earth from the Moon
posts.body: I didn’t feel like a giant. I felt very, very small.

posts.title: Apollo 14 Mission
posts.body: When I first looked back at the Earth, standing on the Moon, I cried.

posts.title: Pale Blue Dot image description
posts.body: There is perhaps no better a demonstration of the folly of human conceits than this distant image of our tiny world.

posts.title: The Great Wall of China from space
posts.body: The scenery was very beautiful. But I did not see The Great Wall [of China].

posts.title: Perspective from Apollo 14
posts.body: From out there on the Moon, international politics look so petty. You want to grab a politician by the scruff of the neck and drag him a quarter of a million miles out and say, 'Look at that, you son of a bitch.'

posts.title: Mars Polar Lander Do You Copy?
posts.body: We have your satellite. If you want it back send 20 billion in Martian money. No funny business or you will never see it again.

posts.title: First spoken words on the moon
posts.body: Contact light.

posts.title: Nervous Much?
posts.body: Anyone who sits on top of the largest hydrogen-oxygen fueled system in the world, knowing they’re going to light the bottom, and doesn’t get a little worried, does not fully understand the situation.

posts.title: Engraved
posts.body:
HERE MEN FROM THE PLANET EARTH
FIRST SET FOOT UPON THE MOON
JULY 1969, A.D.
WE CAME IN PEACE FOR ALL MANKIND

posts.title: Dreams of Mars
posts.body: It’s a fixer-upper of a planet but we could make it work.

posts.title: Apollo 11 Descent
posts.body: I say, this has really been drama of the highest order.

posts.title: My Vision for Space Exploration
posts.body: Mars has been flown by, orbited, smacked into, radar examined, and rocketed onto, as well as bounced upon, rolled over, shoveled, drilled into, baked and even blasted. Still to come: Mars being stepped on.

posts.title: It's Just Not.
posts.body: Failure is not an option

posts.title: First Man
posts.body: It doesn’t sound like there was time for the word to be there. On the other hand, I didn’t intentionally make an inane statement… certainly the ‘a’ was intended, because that’s the only way the statement makes any sense.

posts.title: Furthest Free-Flying Spacewalk
posts.body: That may have been ‘one small step’ for Neil, but it’s a heck of a big leap for me!

posts.title: Paint and nothing else
posts.body: It means nothing to me. I have no opinion about it, and I don’t care.

posts.title: Apollo 13
posts.body: Okay, Houston, we’ve had a problem here.

posts.title: Two Words <To Depart><Process of Flying Through The Air>
posts.body: Go Flight.

posts.title: Searching for Interstellar Communications
posts.body: The probability of success is difficult to estimate; but if we never search the chance of success is zero.
